content:
The avatar is located at (2, 21). George is located at (2, 9) and (2, 10). There are `quiet` citizens at (2, 3), (2, 12), (2, 13).
I want to move the avatar away from george and towards the quiet citizens.
I will move the avatar to the left.

Action: 2
```Action: 2```
I expect the avatar to move one step to the left, away from George.

The avatar is at row=2, col=20. George is at row=2, col=9 and row=2, col=10. Several quiet citizens are around the map. The closest one is at row=2, col=12. I will move left to get closer to the quiet citizen.
Action: 2
```Feedback: Moving left to get closer to the quiet citizen at (2, 12) to pacify them.```

The avatar is at row=2, col=19. The two Georges are at row=2, col=9 and row=2, col=10. There are several quiet citizens around. I should try to move away from the Georges. I will move to the right first.
Action: 3

Okay, I am at (2,20). I see `@` at (1,9), `@` at (2,9). Also there are many `#` around. The closest `#` to me is (2,21). I will go right to convert `#` to `.`.
Action: 3

The avatar is at (2, 21). There are two Georges at (1, 10) and (2, 10). There are quiet citizens around me. The goal is to either survive 1000 time steps or pacify all annoyed citizens. I want to move away from the Georges and towards the citizens on the left.

Action: 2
```Action: 2```
I will move to the left, away from the George and closer to the citizens.

The avatar is at (2, 20). George is at (1, 12). There are many quiet citizens around the map, especially above and to the left. The closest quiet citizen is at (2, 14) or (3, 4). I will move left to avoid George.
Action: 2
I will move left to avoid george and potentially be able to pacify a citizen.```Action: 2```

The avatar is at (2, 19). George is at (1, 12) and there is a george quiet at (1, 13).
The `george` is close, so I should move away.
I can move to (1,19), (3,19), (2,20).

Move down to evade George.

Action: 4

Okay, I see a `george` (@) at (1, 12) near an `%`, which means `george` is also touching a `quiet` citizen. I also see a lot of `quiet` citizens (#) around the map. My avatar (a) is at (3, 19). I need to avoid George and try to pacify the annoyed citizens. Since the win condition is surviving for 1000 time steps, I will move away from george first.

Action: 2
``` Feedback: Moving left to create distance between avatar and george, while trying to stay near `quiet` citizens for future pacification. ```

The avatar is at (3,18). George is at (1,12), and there are several annoyed citizens around him at (1,13), (1,14), (2,13), (2,14). There are also quiet citizens at (3,4), (3,5), (4,4), (4,5), (4,17), (4,18), (5,1), (5,2), (5,8), (5,17), (5,18), (6,1), (6,2), (6,8), (8,1), (8,5), (8,19), (9,1), (9,18). The closest annoyed citizen is at (2,14). To pacify the citizens, I will move up, and then to the left to be closer to the annoyed citizens.
Action: 5
I expect to move up.```Action: 5```

The avatar is at (3, 18). There are two `annoyed` citizens at (1, 14) and (2, 14). There's a `george` touching `annoyed` citizens at (1, 13) and (2, 13). I should try to shoot the `annoyed` citizens. I'll move to the left first, then shoot.

Action: 2
```Feedback: Move left to have a better angle to shoot the annoyed citizens at (1, 14) and (2, 14).```

The avatar is at (3, 17). There are two Georges nearby at (2, 14) and (3, 14). There are also two annoyed citizens at (1, 15) and (2, 15). My strategy should be to focus on pacifying the annoyed citizens. First, I will move to the right to create distance between me and the two Georges.
Action: 3
I expect the avatar to move to the right.```Action: 3```

The avatar is at (3, 18). George is at (3, 17), which is very close. There is an `annoyed` citizen at (2, 16) and an `annoyed george` at (3, 16). I should move away from George and towards the `annoyed` citizen to pacify them. Moving up seems reasonable.
Action: 5
I expect to move up and away from George and be in a position to pacify the annoyed citizen.```Action: 5```

The avatar is at (3, 18). George is at (3, 17), and several annoyed citizens are at (2, 15), (2, 16), (3, 15), and (3, 16). My strategy is to prioritize converting the annoyed citizens. Since George is right next to the avatar, I will first move down and then use the cigarette.
Action: 4
```Feedback: Moving down to avoid George and prepare to shoot at the annoyed citizens.```

The avatar is at (4, 18), there are two `george` (@) at (3, 17) and (4, 17) and two `annoyed` (&) at (2,16) and (3, 16). It's better to move and shoot the `annoyed` citizens.
Action: 2
I will move left to evade George and prepare to shoot the annoyed citizens.```Action: 2```
